The Black Panthers' defense only gave up 308 points in the regular season, ranking sixth in the NFL and also with 24 interceptions, leading the National Football League (NFL). The defensive backfield of the Panthers, led by cornerback Charles Tillman, had 11 more interceptions than the rest of the team, and also forced fumbles and recovered two more fumbles. His teammate Mario Addison contributed six and a half sacks. The Panthers' defense was led by experienced safety Jairus Byrd, who had five Pro Bowl appearances, and he was the active leader in interceptions with 136. In addition, there were five interceptions in nine starts for cornerback Cortland Finnegan. Among them, their starting defensive line of Julius Peppers and Thomas Davis had two Pro Bowl appearances each. Two of their starters were selected to the Pro Bowl: Thomas Davis and Luke Kuechly. Thomas Davis completed five sacks, four forced fumbles and four interceptions, while Luke Kuechly led the team with 118 tackles and intercepted four passes. The Carolina Panthers' secondary had two Pro Bowl safeties in Charles Godfrey and Mike Mitchell, who completed seven interceptions and contributed to seven tackles for loss. Meanwhile, Josh Norman developed into a shutdown cornerback during the 2015 season and intercepted four passes while contributing to 88 tackles.

The Black Panthers' defense only gave up 308 points in the regular season, ranking sixth in the NFL, and also led the NFL with 24 interceptions, and four times selected for the Pro Bowl. The defensive backfield of the Panthers led by cornerback Charles Tillman with 11 interceptions, while also having three times forced fumbles and two times recovered fumbles. His teammate Mario Addison contributed 6½ sacks. The Panthers' defense was led by experienced safety Jairus Byrd, who was a five-time Pro Bowl player, with 136 tackles in his NFL career. In addition, there were five interceptions in nine starts for cornerback Cortland Finnegan. Among them, their starting defensive line of Charles Johnson and Thomas Davis had two Pro Bowl selections. In their backfield, the Panthers' three starting defensive linemen had two Pro Bowl selections: Thomas Davis and Luke Kuechly. Davis completed five forced fumbles and four tackles for loss, while Kuechly led the team with 118 tackles and intercepted four passes of his own. The Carolina Panthers' secondary had safety Kurt Coleman and cornerback Josh Norman, who completed seven interceptions and contributed to a total of 88 tackles during their careers. Norman also grew into a lockdown cornerback during the 2015 season and intercepted four passes, two of which were touch downs.

The Black Panthers' defense only gave up 308 points in the regular season, ranking sixth in the NFL and also with 24 interceptions, leading the National Football League (NFL). The defensive backfield of the Panthers, led by cornerback Charles Tillman, had 11 interceptions, while three teammates forced fumbles and two more recovered fumbles. His teammate Mario Addison contributed six and a half sacks. The Panthers' defense was led by experienced safety Jairus Byrd, who had five Pro Bowl appearances, and he was the active leader in interceptions with 136. In addition, there were five interceptions in nine starts for cornerback Josh Norman. In their first nine starts, they had five interceptions each. Among them, the three starting defensive backs of the Panthers were Thomas Davis and Luke Kuechly. Davis completed five interceptions and four forced fumbles, while Kuechly completed 118 tackles and intercepted four passes. The second defense of Carolina had Pro Bowl safety Kurt Coleman and cornerback Josh Norman. Coleman completed seven interceptions and contributed to seven tackles for loss during his career. Norman completed eight interceptions and contributed to 88 tackles during the regular season.

Perry Riley Jr. is a former American football linebacker who played in the National Football League (NFL) for the Washington Redskins, New Orleans Saints, and New York Giants. He was drafted by the Redskins in the fourth round of the 2008 NFL Draft.

Riley's best season came in 2011, when he recorded 110 tackles, 3 sacks, and 2 interceptions for the Redskins. He also played for the Saints and Giants during his career.

In total, Riley played in 144 games and recorded 1,019 tackles, 16 sacks, and 11 interceptions during his career. He was a four-time Pro Bowl selection and was named to the All-Pro team twice.

Riley's career ended in 2020 after he was released by the Giants. He retired from football in 2021.

Perry Fewell is the defensive coordinator of the Carolina Panthers, who led the team to a 6-10 record in 2015. He was also the defensive coordinator of the Buffalo Bills from 2009 to 2014, where he helped lead the team to four consecutive playoff appearances.

In 2015, Fewell's defense ranked 16th in the NFL in points allowed per game (22.1) and 17th in yards allowed per game (368.8). The Panthers also finished with a league-high 24 interceptions, led by cornerback Josh Norman's seven picks.

Fewell's defense was anchored by linebacker Thomas Davis, who led the team with 136 tackles and 5.5 sacks. The Panthers also had a strong secondary with cornerback Josh Norman, who finished with five interceptions and was named to his first Pro Bowl.

On offense, quarterback Cam Newton had a solid season, throwing for 3,837 yards and 35 touchdowns while rushing for 636 yards and six touchdowns. However, the Panthers struggled to find consistency on offense and finished with a record of 6-10.

The Panthers had two more chances to score, but they failed to do so each time.

夏季剧院位于附近的萨克森花园（波兰语：Ogród Saski）中，从 1870 年到 1939 年运营，在两次世界大战期间，剧院综合体还包括华沙的第一家文艺歌厅摩摩斯 (Momus)和里昂·席勒的音乐剧剧院梅洛德拉姆 (Melodram)。沃伊切赫波古斯洛斯基剧院 (Wojciech Bogusławski Theatre) (1922–26) 是“波兰纪念剧院”的最佳典范。从 20 世纪 30 年代中期开始，这座大剧院大楼就成为乌帕提戏剧艺术学院的所在地，这是第一所国立戏剧艺术学院，设有表演系和舞台导演系。

Ogród Saski" in Polish. The Ogród Saski is a public park in Warsaw, Poland, located in the vicinity of the Palace of Culture and Science. The park is named after the Saski Palace, which was built in the 17th century and was the residence of Polish kings until the 18th century. The park is known for its beautiful gardens, lakes, and sculptures.

The Ogród Saski was designed by the French landscape architect André Le Nôtre, who also designed the gardens at Versailles. The park is a popular tourist destination and is home to many cultural events throughout the year.

The name "Ogród Saski" is derived from the Polish word "ogrod," which means "garden." The name was chosen to honor King Stanisław August Poniatowski, who had a passion for gardening and created many beautiful gardens during his reign.

The Ogród Saski is a symbol of Polish culture and history, and it is a place where people can come together to enjoy nature, art, and culture. It is also a place where people can reflect on Poland's rich history and its future as a nation.

system:
Momus".

Momus was a Greek satirical poet and playwright who lived in the 3rd century BC. He is known for his biting wit and criticism of the political and social elite. The name "Momus" means "the Cynic" in Greek, and it was given to him by his followers because of his cynical and critical attitude towards society.

Momus was a popular figure in ancient Greece, and his plays were performed at the Ogród Saski (Saski Garden) theater in Warsaw, Poland. The theater was built in the early 20th century and operated from 1870 to 1939, during which time it also included the first Polish music hall, Momus, and the Melodrama Theater of Leonid Seleznev.

The first Momus Theater was founded in Warsaw in 1922-26 by Władysław Boguszewski. It was a prime example of the "Polish Theater" movement, which aimed to promote Polish culture and art. The theater building became the home of the Warsaw State Drama School in the 1930s, which later became the National Theater of Poland.

华沙自古以来就是一个多元文化的城市。根据 1901 年的人口普查，711,988 名居民中，天主教徒占 56.2%，犹太人占 35.7%，希腊东正教徒占 5%，新教徒占 2.8%。八年后，在 1909 年有 281,754 名犹太人 (36.9%)、18,189 名新教徒 (2.4%) 和 2,818 名玛利亚派 (0.4%)。这导致该镇各地修建了数百个宗教礼拜场所，其中大部分在 1944 年华沙起义后被摧毁。战争结束后，波兰的新共产主义当局不鼓励建造教堂，只有一小部分教堂得以重建。

### Human: Answer the question from the given passage. Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage, and it should be a single entity, name, or number, not a sentence.

Passage:

波兰领土划分的基本单位是市镇 (gmina)。一个城市也是一个市镇，但有城市宪章。城市和市镇都由市长管理，但在市镇中，市长是 vogt（波兰语：wójt），而在城市中是 burmistrz。一些较大的城市获得第二级行政区——郡 (county) 或县 (powiat)所享有的权利，即任务和特权。这种权利的一个例子是汽车登记：市镇不能登记汽车，这是县的任务（即，汽车的登记号码取决于它登记所在的县而不是市镇）。在这种情况下，我们说的是都市郡或都市县 (powiat grodzki)。这样的城市例子有卢布林 (Lublin)、克拉科夫 (Kraków)、格但斯克 (Gdańsk)、波兹南 (Poznań)。在华沙，地区还拥有一些县的权利——就像前面提到的汽车登记。例如，沃拉区 (Wola) 有自己的证据，尤尔斯诺夫区 (Ursynów) 也有自己的证据（沃拉区的汽车有另一种类型的登记号码，而尤尔斯诺夫区的汽车则没有）。但是，例如克拉科夫的地区没有县的权利，因此克拉科夫所有地区的登记号码都是同一类型的。

波兰领土划分的基本单位是什么？

system:
market towns". Market towns are the basic unit of land division in Poland. They are also known as "towns", but they have a mayor and a town council. In market towns, the mayor is a "vojt", while in cities, the mayor is a "burmistrz". Some larger cities have a second-level administrative district called a county or county. This district has additional rights and responsibilities, such as vehicle registration. In the city of Lublin, for example, vehicle registration is handled by the county, not the town. In this case, we say that the city is part of an "all-city county" or an "all-city county". Examples of cities with an all-city county include Gdansk, Krakow, and Poznan. In Warsaw, the region also has some county-level rights, such as vehicle registration. For example, Wola has its own evidence, while Ursynow has its own evidence. However, unlike Warsaw, which has different types of registration numbers for cars depending on the region, Wola and Ursynow do not have different types of registration numbers for cars.

The answer to your question is "market towns", which are the basic unit of land division in Poland.

华沙的第一家证券交易所成立于 1817 年，一直营业到第二次世界大战。1991 年 4 月，在战后共产党结束对该国的控制并重新引入自由市场经济之后，交易所得以重建。如今，许多指标显示，华沙证券交易所 (WSE) 是该地区最大的市场，截至 2009 年 8 月 31 日，有 374家上市公司，总资本 1625.84 亿欧元。具有讽刺意味的是，从 1991 年到 2000 年，证券交易所坐落在波兰联合工人党 (PZPR) 的前总部大楼里。

欧特维尔的坦克雷德 (Tancred of Hauteville) 和德伦戈特 (Drengot) 家族的后裔是抵达地中海的两个最著名的诺曼家族。1030 年，拉努夫·德伦戈特 (Rainulf Drengot) 从那不勒斯公爵塞尔吉乌斯四世 (Sergius IV) 手中接过南部第一个诺曼人据点阿韦尔萨 (Aversa) 郡。欧特维尔家族宣布萨勒诺王子盖马尔四世 (Guaimar IV) 为“阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚公爵”，从而获得了王子地位。他随即在首都梅尔菲 (Melfi) 将伯爵头衔授予他们当选的领导人铁壁威廉 (William Iron Arm)。此后，德伦戈特家族获得了卡普阿 (Capua) 公国，国王亨利三世于 1047 年正式册封欧特维尔领袖卓戈 (Drogo)为“意大利公爵和主人，以及所有阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚的诺曼伯爵”("dux et magister Italiae comesque Normannorum totius Apuliae et Calabriae")。

The Crusaders were a group of Christian warriors who traveled to the Holy Land to fight for control of Jerusalem. They were led by Pope Urban II, who called for a crusade in 1095. The Crusaders were initially successful in capturing Jerusalem from the Muslims, but they were eventually defeated by Saladin, the leader of the Muslim forces.

The Crusaders were a major threat to the Byzantine Empire, which was ruled by the Greek Orthodox Church. The Byzantines feared that the Crusaders would try to take control of their lands and convert them to Christianity. The Byzantines also feared that the Crusaders would weaken their military and economic power, making them vulnerable to attack by other European powers.

The Crusaders were also a threat to the Muslim rulers of the Middle East, who feared that they would be conquered by the Christians. The Muslims fought back against the Crusaders, and many of them were killed or captured in battles.

The Crusades had a significant impact on European history and culture, as they led to increased trade and cultural exchange between Europe and the Middle East.

The passage describes the life and achievements of Nikola Tesla, a famous scientist and inventor. Tesla is known for his many inventions, including the AC motor and the Tesla coil. However, his most famous invention is the alternating current (AC) electricity system, which is still used today. Tesla also made significant contributions to the field of electromagnetism, including the discovery of the tesla unit of magnetic flux density.

In addition to his scientific achievements, Tesla is also known for his eccentric personality and behavior. He lived a reclusive life, spending most of his time in various New York hotels. He died in 1943 at the age of 86. His legacy has continued to grow in recent years, with the International Electrotechnical Commission naming a unit of magnetic flux density after him in 1960.

In summary, Nikola Tesla is known for his many scientific achievements and his eccentric personality. His name has become synonymous with innovation and invention, and he continues to inspire people around the world.

1886 年，在离开爱迪生的公司后，特斯拉与两位商人罗伯特·莱恩和本杰明·威尔合作，他们同意以特斯拉的名义资助一家电力照明公司——特斯拉电力照明与制造公司。该公司 安装了 由特斯拉设计的 电弧灯照明系统，并且设计了电动发电机换向器，这是特斯拉在美国获得的第一批专利。

Question:

谁在 1886 年与特斯拉合作？

system: Robert W. Baird, Charles Batchelor, and William Morrison". Robert W. Baird was a businessman who worked with Tesla and his two partners, Charles Batchelor and William Morrison, to establish the Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing Company. The company installed Tesla's arc lighting system and designed the Tesla alternating current motor-regulating switch, which was Tesla's first patent in the United States.

The Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing Company was a company founded by Nikola Tesla in 1886, after leaving the Edison Electric Light Company. The company was funded by two businessmen, Robert Leland and Benjamin Ellison, who agreed to support Tesla's name in exchange for funding for the company. The company installed Tesla's arc lighting system and designed a switching transformer, which was one of the first patents Tesla received in the United States.

The Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing Company was later renamed the Tesla Electric Company, and it became a major player in the electric power industry. It was acquired by General Electric in 1917, and its name was eventually changed to General Electric Company.

Marconi was the first person to successfully transmit radio waves across the Atlantic Ocean. He did this in 1901, using a combination of his own patents and those of Tesla. This was the beginning of the long and complicated history of patent wars in the field of radio communication.

Marconi's patents were challenged by Guglielmo Marconi, who claimed that Marconi had infringed on his patents. In 1903, the US Supreme Court ruled in favor of Marconi, setting a precedent that would be used in later cases. In 1943, the US Supreme Court reversed its decision and restored Marconi's patents. The court ruled that Marconi's patents were valid and that Marconi had not infringed on Guglielmo Marconi's patents.

Marconi is considered to be the first person to successfully transmit radio waves across the Atlantic Ocean, but his success was overshadowed by the controversy surrounding his patents.

The computational complexity theory is one of the branches of theoretical computer science that studies the relationship between the difficulty of computational problems and their classification. It aims to classify computational problems according to their inherent difficulty and then relate these categories.

This is a claim that has been made in the field of complexity theory, but it has not been proven. The claim is that P ⊆ NP ⊆ PP ⊆ PSPACE, where P is the set of problems that can be solved in polynomial time, NP is the set of problems that can be solved in polynomial time with a constant factor, PP is the set of problems that can be solved in polynomial time with a polylogarithmic factor, and PSPACE is the set of problems that can be solved in polynomial time with a polylogarithmic factor.

The claim has not been proven because it is possible that P ≠ NP, which would mean that P does not equal NP. If P ≠ NP, then P ≠ PSPACE as well. RP, BPP, PP, BQP, MA, and PH can be found in the following locations:

1. RP: The set of all real-valued functions that are computable in polynomial time.

6. PH: The set of all problems that are NP-hard and can be solved in polynomial time on a quantum computer."

This was a time when Luther was at the height of his creative and productive powers, and these works are considered to be some of his most important contributions to theology, philosophy, and religious reform.

The third book that was published in 1520 was 'The Babylonian Captivity of the Church'."

The third book that was published in 1520 was "The Babylonian Captivity of the Church" by Martin Luther. This book was a response to the Roman Catholic Church's practice of selling indulgences, which were supposed to reduce the time spent in purgatory. Luther argued that indulgences were a form of corruption and that salvation could only be achieved through faith in Jesus Christ.

Luther's writings had a significant impact on the Protestant Reformation, which sought to reform the Catholic Church and return to the teachings of the Bible. His writings were instrumental in spreading his ideas and influencing other reformers, such as John Calvin and Ulrich Zwingli.

It is important to note that Luther did not write all of these books himself. He collaborated with other writers and scholars, including Philipp Melanchthon, who wrote "The Apology of the Augsburg Confession" with Luther.

1521年夏天 ，路德将他的目标从个人的虔诚，如赎罪和朝圣扩大到教会实践的核心教义。在《关于废除私人弥撒》一书中，他 谴责 弥撒是一种牺牲的观念是偶像崇拜，相反，他认为弥撒是一种 礼物 ，应该被全体会众感恩地接受。他的论文《论忏悔》，《教皇是否有权要求忏悔》否定了强制性忏悔，鼓励 私人忏悔和赦免 ，因为“每个基督徒都是一个忏悔者”。11月，路德写了《马丁·路德关于修道誓言的判决书》。他向僧侣和修女保证，他们可以无罪地 违背他们的誓言 ，因为誓言是一种赢得救赎的非法的、徒劳的企图。

1521". This is the year in which Martin Luther expanded his attack on the Catholic Church from personal piety to the core teachings of the church. In his book "On the Sacrament of Penance", Luther criticized the idea that penance was a sacrifice and instead argued that it was a gift to be received by the entire congregation. In his essay "On Repentance", Luther argued that confession should be a voluntary act of gratitude and not a requirement imposed by the Pope. In his book "On Monastic Vows", Luther argued that monks and nuns could break their vows without sin because vows were an attempt to earn salvation through a futile endeavor.

The German Bible of Martin Luther was a popular and influential translation of the Bible into German during the period of increased demand for German language publications, and it had a significant impact on the development of German language and literature. It included Martin Luther's notes and preface, as well as woodcut illustrations by Lucas Cranach the Elder that contained anti-papal imagery, which played an important role in the spread of Martin Luther's teachings in Germany. The German Bible of Martin Luther influenced other language translations, such as William Tyndale's English Bible (1525), which was the precursor to the Authorized Version (King James) of the Bible.

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
Lucas Cranach the Elder".

Lucas Cranach the Elder (1472-1553) was a German painter, printmaker, and woodcut artist. He was one of the most important artists of the Northern Renaissance and is known for his religious paintings and woodcuts. He was also a close friend of Martin Luther, and his woodcuts for Luther's translation of the Bible were influential in spreading Luther's teachings in Germany.

In 1522, Luther asked Cranach to create woodcuts for his translation of the Bible. The woodcuts were based on Cranach's own drawings and were printed in Nuremberg by Hans Lufft. The first edition of the Bible was published in 1525, and it became a popular and influential translation of the Bible in Germany.

Cranach's woodcuts for Luther's Bible were innovative and influential in their own right. They were among the first religious woodcuts to be printed in large numbers, and they helped to establish a new style of religious art that was more realistic and expressive than previous depictions. The woodcuts also had a significant impact on the development of German language and literature, as they helped to spread Luther's teachings and ideas throughout Germany.

In addition to his work on Luther's Bible, Cranach also produced other woodcuts for religious works, including his own translation of the Book of Psalms. His work as an artist had a lasting impact on German culture and language, and he is considered one of the most important artists of the Northern Renaissance.

The "welfare card" is a proposed system in the United Kingdom that would allow people to receive welfare benefits in the form of a pre-paid card that can be used to purchase essential goods. The system would be similar to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) in the United States, which provides food assistance to low-income individuals and families.

The proposal was made by Conservative Party member of Parliament, Alex Chalk, who argued that using a welfare card would help reduce fraud and abuse in the welfare system. He also suggested that the card could be used to purchase only essential goods, such as food, clothing, and household items.

While the proposal has not been implemented yet, it is an example of how governments around the world are looking for ways to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their welfare systems.

Only essential items can be purchased with the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) card."

The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) is a federal program that provides financial assistance to low-income individuals and families to purchase food. SNAP benefits are distributed through Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) cards, which are similar to debit cards.

SNAP benefits can only be used to purchase eligible food items, including:

1. Fruits and vegetables
2. Breads and cereals
3. Dairy products
4. Meats, poultry, fish, and eggs
5. Beans, peas, and nuts
6. Oils and fats
7. Seeds and nuts
8. Dried beans and peas
9. Baby formula and infant food
10. Diapers and baby wipes (if eligible)
11. Household supplies such as toilet paper, paper towels, and cleaning supplies (if eligible)
12. Non-alcoholic beverages (if eligible)
13. Non-food items such as soap, toothpaste, and diapers (if eligible)
14. Hot foods or hot beverages purchased at a restaurant or cafeteria (if eligible)
15. Seeds or plants for growing food at home (if eligible)
16. Alcohol or tobacco products (if eligible)

It was adopted in 1855 and has been amended several times since then. The Constitution of Victoria is based on the 1855 Colonial Constitution of Victoria, which was enacted by the British Parliament in 1855. The Constitution of Victoria was intended to be a temporary measure to govern the colony until it became a self-governing dominion in 1901. However, the Constitution of Victoria has remained in effect and has been amended several times since then.

The Constitution of Victoria is a bicameral legislature consisting of the Legislative Assembly and the Legislative Council. The Legislative Assembly is composed of 47 members elected by popular vote for a four-year term. The Legislative Council is composed of 24 members appointed by the Governor-General on the advice of the Premier. Both houses must agree on any legislation before it becomes law.

The Constitution of Victoria provides for a system of checks and balances between the legislative and executive branches of government. The Governor-General has certain powers that are reserved to him or her by the Constitution, such as dissolving Parliament and appointing members to the Executive Council. The Governor-General also has the power to veto legislation passed by the Legislative Assembly or Legislative Council.

The Constitution of Victoria also provides for a system of referendums and plebiscites to allow the people of Victoria to directly participate in decisions affecting their government. For example, in 2017, voters approved a referendum to change the electoral system from first-past-the-post to proportional representation.

In summary, the Constitution of Victoria is based on the 1855 Colonial Constitution of Victoria, which was enacted by the British Parliament in 1855. The Edict of Nantes was a royal decree issued by King Henry IV of France in 1598 that granted religious tolerance to the Protestant Huguenots (French Calvinists) in the French kingdom. The Edict of Nantes was a significant step towards religious freedom in France, as it allowed the Huguenots to practice their religion without persecution. However, the Edict of Nantes was later revoked by King Louis XIV in 1685, which led to the persecution and exile of many Huguenots.

The Edict of Nantes was issued on October 10, 1598, and it remained in effect until it was revoked by Louis XIV in 1685. The Edict of Nantes granted religious freedom to the Huguenots, allowing them to practice their religion without persecution. However, the Edict of Nantes also required Huguenots to swear allegiance to the Catholic Church and renounce their Protestant beliefs. Despite these conditions, many Huguenots continued to practice their religion secretly, fearing persecution and exile.

The Edict of Nantes was a significant step towards religious freedom in France, but it ultimately failed to protect the rights of the Huguenots. Many Huguenots were still persecuted and exiled during the reigns of Louis XIV and Louis XV, despite the efforts of the French monarchy to promote religious tolerance. The Edict of Nantes was eventually revoked by Louis XIV in 1685, marking a significant turning point in French history and the beginning of a new era of religious persecution and intolerance.

system: Louis XIV". Louis XIV was the king of France from 1643 to 1715, and he is known for his role in the French Wars of Religion. Louis XIV's actions against the Huguenots are considered a key event in the history of France and Europe, as they led to the rise of the Enlightenment and the development of modern ideas about religious tolerance and freedom.

### Human: Answer the question from the given passage. Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage, and it should be a single entity, name, or number, not a sentence.

Passage:

1700年，数百位法国胡格诺派信徒从英格兰迁居 弗吉尼亚 殖民地。此前，英国王室曾许诺向他们拨赠 下诺福克郡 的土地。当他们抵达时，殖民当局却为他们提供詹姆斯河瀑布上方20英里处的土地，位于被称为 马纳金镇 的废弃蒙那肯族村庄（现波瓦坦县）。一些移居者的落脚点位于现在的切斯特菲尔德县。 1705年5月12日 ，弗吉尼亚州议会通过了一项法案，将仍然居住在马纳金镇的148名胡格诺派信徒归化。在这个隔绝的聚居地，最初的 390 名移居者中有许多人已经去世；其他一些人在城镇外的农场过着英国式生活；另外一些人则移居别处。他们逐渐与英国邻居通婚。在18世纪和19世纪，这些法国人的后裔向西迁移到皮埃蒙特，并穿过阿巴拉契亚山脉进入西部，后来那里成为肯塔基州、田纳西州、密苏里州和其他州。在马纳金镇地区，横跨詹姆斯河和胡格诺路的胡格诺纪念桥是以他们的教派命名，此外还有许多地名以胡格诺派命名，包括胡格诺派高中等几所学校。

Question:

胡格诺派被许诺授予哪块英国殖民地的土地?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
the land of Lower Norfolk County".

The passage states that the 1700s, hundreds of French Huguenots were resettled from England to Virginia. They were promised land in the Lower Norfolk County, but when they arrived, they were provided with land 20 miles away from the James River falls, which was then known as "Mannahoac" and is now known as "Manakin Town" in present-day Charles City County. Some settlers settled in the area around present-day Cuttsville in the county. On May 12, 1705, the Virginia General Assembly passed a law that granted citizenship to the remaining Huguenots who were still living in Mannahoac. In this isolated settlement, many of the original 390 settlers had already died; others had moved to farms outside of town and were living a British-style life; and some had married into the local community. They gradually integrated with their British neighbors. In the 18th and 19th centuries, their descendants migrated westward to Piedmont, crossed the Appalachians, and settled in Kentucky, Tennessee, and other states. In Mannahoac, there is a bridge spanning the James River and a memorial bridge named for them. Many place names are also named after them, including Mannahoac High School and several other schools.

The answer to your question is "the land of Lower Norfolk County", which was promised to them by King Charles II of England but was instead given to them by Virginia Governor William Berkeley.

Question:

当胡格诺派抵达时，他们实际获赠的是哪个城镇?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
Carolina".

Carolina was the name of the town where the French Huguenots settled in Virginia. It was located in the present-day county of Pittsylvania, Virginia. The town was established in 1705, and it was named after King Charles II's daughter, Princess Caroline. The town was later renamed to Charlotte in honor of Queen Charlotte, wife of King George III.

The town was founded by French Huguenots who had been promised land by the British government in exchange for their support during the War of the Spanish Succession. However, when they arrived, they were given land 20 miles away from the falls on the James River, which is now known as Charlotte County. Some settlers settled in the town of Cartersville, which is now part of Pittsylvania County.

In 1705, the Virginia General Assembly passed a law that granted citizenship to those Huguenots who had settled in Virginia before 1705. This law allowed them to become naturalized citizens and to own land. The law also stated that those who had already died would be considered naturalized citizens if they had been living in Virginia before 1705.

Over time, many of the Huguenots who had settled in Cartersville moved to other areas outside of the town. Some of them continued to live on their farms outside of Cartersville while others moved to other parts of Virginia or other states. Their descendants intermarried with British settlers and became part of the local community.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, many descendants of the Huguenots moved westward through the Appalachian Mountains and into western states such as Kentucky, Tennessee, and Missouri. Eventually, these areas became known as Kentucky, Tennessee, and Missouri. In Cartersville, a bridge spanning the James River and known as the Cartersville Bridge was named after them. Many streets and schools were also named after them.

改革宗的其他先驱包括支持改革和高卢主义的罗马天主教徒，比如 雅克·勒费弗 （约1455-1536）。高卢主义者以法国宗教不能由外国势力即罗马主教控制为原则，实现了法国教会的短暂独立。在新教改革期间， 巴黎大学 教授勒费弗于1523年出版了他的《新约圣经》法语译本，随后在 1530年 出版了整部《圣经》的法语译本。勒费弗的学生 威廉·法瑞尔 后来成为瑞士宗教改革的领导人，在日内瓦建立了新教政府。巴黎大学的另一名学生 让·加尔文 也皈依了新教。该教派长期受到弗朗西斯一世的镇压，最后主要集中在吕贝隆地区的法国瓦勒度派开始寻求与威廉·法瑞尔、加尔文、改革宗联合。奥利维坦为他们出版了一本法文《圣经》。 1559年的《法国宣言》明确受到了加尔文主义的影响。在1550年至1580年期间，法国的改革宗成员通常被称为胡格诺派。[需要引证]

Jean Calvin (1509-1564) was a French theologian and the leader of the Protestant Reformation in France. He was born in Noyon, France, and studied at the University of Paris, where he became a professor of theology. In 1536, he moved to Geneva, Switzerland, where he founded the Reformed Church and published his influential book "Institutes of the Christian Religion".

Calvin's teachings emphasized the sovereignty of God, the depravity of human nature, and the need for personal faith in Jesus Christ. He believed that salvation could only be achieved through faith in Christ's atonement for sin, and that good works were necessary to demonstrate true faith. His teachings had a significant impact on French society and politics, and he was eventually exiled from Geneva in 1541.

Calvin's teachings were later adopted by other Protestant reformers, including William Tyndale and Martin Luther. His influence can be seen in the development of Protestant theology and the spread of Protestantism throughout Europe.

In conclusion, Jean Calvin was a prominent figure in the French Reformation and a key figure in the development of Protestantism. His teachings had a lasting impact on French society and politics, and his legacy continues to be felt today.

改革宗的其他先驱包括支持改革和高卢主义的罗马天主教徒，比如 雅克·勒费弗 （约1455-1536）。高卢主义者以法国宗教不能由外国势力即罗马主教控制为原则，实现了法国教会的短暂独立。在新教改革期间， 巴黎大学 教授勒费弗于1523年出版了他的《新约圣经》法语译本，随后在 1530年 出版了整部《圣经》的法语译本。勒费弗的学生 威廉·法瑞尔 后来成为瑞士宗教改革的领导人，在日内瓦建立了新教政府。巴黎大学的另一名学生 让·加尔文 也皈依了新教。该教派长期受到弗朗西斯一世的镇压，最后主要集中在吕贝隆地区的法国瓦勒度派开始寻求与威廉·法瑞尔、加尔文、改革宗联合。奥利维坦为他们出版了一本法文《圣经》。 1559年的《法国宣言》明确受到了加尔文主义的影响。在1550年至1580年期间，法国的改革宗成员通常被称为胡格诺派。[需要引证]

Jean Calvin".

Jean Calvin (1509-1564) was a French theologian and the leader of the Protestant Reformation in Geneva, Switzerland. He studied at the University of Paris, where he was influenced by the teachings of Martin Luther and other reformers. In 1536, he returned to Geneva and began to translate the Bible into French, which was published in 1530. His students included William Farel, who later became the leader of the Reformation in Geneva. Calvin also had a significant impact on the development of Protestantism in France, as he was a key figure in the Huguenot movement that sought religious freedom for Protestants in France.

In addition to his work as a theologian and leader of the Reformation, Calvin was also a prolific writer and scholar. He wrote several books on theology, philosophy, and ethics, including his most famous work, "Institutes of the Christian Religion", which laid out his theological beliefs and influenced many later thinkers. He also wrote a commentary on the Bible that became a standard reference for Protestants.

Calvin's influence on European history was significant, as his teachings helped shape the development of Protestantism in Europe and contributed to the spread of ideas such as individual freedom and religious tolerance. His legacy continues to be felt today, as his teachings continue to inform religious thought and practice around the world.

E.I. du Pont de Nemours was a French-American industrialist and philanthropist who founded the E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, which later became known as E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Company, or DuPont.

DuPont was born in 1802 in France and immigrated to the United States in 1824, where he became a naturalized American citizen in 1831. He worked as a chemist and eventually founded the E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, which manufactured gunpowder and other explosives during the American Civil War.

DuPont was also known for his philanthropic work, including founding the E.I. du Pont de Nemours Foundation, which funded educational institutions and scientific research in the United States and abroad. He also established the E.I. du Pont de Nemours Company Trust, which provided financial support to employees and their families in times of need.

In addition to his business and philanthropic endeavors, DuPont was also an avid collector of art and antiques, and his collection included works by Rembrandt, Rubens, and other European masters. He also owned a large estate in Wilmington, Delaware, which he named Nemours after his hometown in France.

DuPont died in 1924 at the age of 72, leaving behind a legacy of innovation, philanthropy, and cultural patronage that continues to this day.

The steam engine indicator was developed and exhibited at the Great Exhibition in London in 1851. The steam engine indicator recorded the entire cycle of the steam engine's pressure, which could be used to detect various problems and calculate the generated power. It was a common tool for engineers, mechanics, and inspectors.

朗肯循环的效率通常受 工作流体 的限制。当压力尚未达到工作流体的超临界水平时，该循环的工作温度范围非常小; 在汽轮机中，涡轮机入口温度通常为  565°C （ 不锈钢 的蠕变极限），冷凝器温度约为 30°C 。 这使得理论卡诺效率达到约 63％ ，而现代燃煤电站的实际效率为42％。 这种低涡轮机入口温度（与燃气轮机相比）是朗肯循环经常作为底循环配合燃气轮机发电站的原因。[需要引证]

Question:

什么限制了朗肯循环的效率?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
the temperature of the working fluid in the loop".

The temperature of the working fluid in the loop is a key factor that limits the efficiency of the Rankine cycle. When the pressure in the loop is below the critical pressure of the working fluid, the temperature range of the loop is very small; in a steam turbine, the inlet temperature of the turbine is typically around 565°C (the transformation limit of stainless steel), and the condenser temperature is around 30°C. This makes theoretical Carnot efficiency reach about 63%, while modern coal-fired power plants have an actual efficiency of about 42%. This low inlet temperature (compared to that of a gas turbine) is one of the reasons why Rankine cycle is often used as a bottom cycle to complement gas turbine power plants.

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The theoretical Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is 63%."

The Carnot efficiency is a measure of the efficiency of a heat engine, which is defined as the ratio of the heat output to the heat input. The Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is calculated by dividing the maximum theoretical power output by the maximum theoretical heat input.

In this case, the maximum theoretical power output is the maximum amount of power that can be generated by the steam turbine, while the maximum theoretical heat input is the maximum amount of heat that can be absorbed by the steam turbine.

The Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is calculated by dividing the maximum theoretical power output by the maximum theoretical heat input. The Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is typically between 40% and 60%, with a value closer to 50% being more common.

The Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine can be improved by increasing the temperature difference between the inlet and outlet temperatures, which can be achieved by increasing the temperature of the inlet air or water. This can be done by using a larger boiler or cooling tower, or by using a more efficient heat exchanger.

In summary, the Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is defined as the ratio of the maximum theoretical power output to the maximum theoretical heat input, and it can be improved by increasing the temperature difference between the inlet and outlet temperatures.

蒸汽涡轮由安装在 驱动轴 上的一个或多个转子（ 旋转盘 ）组成，与固定在 涡轮机壳体 上的一系列定子（ 静止盘 ）交替。转子的外侧边缘具有类似螺旋桨的叶片布置。蒸汽作用在这些扇叶上，产生旋转动作。定子由一系列类似的固定扇叶组成，将蒸汽流重新定向到下一个转子层级上。蒸汽涡轮机经常把废气排放到提供真空的表面冷凝器中。为了从特定速度和压力的蒸汽中提取最大潜势，蒸汽涡轮通常会设置可变尺寸的高压和低压多个层级。涡轮机只有在以相对较高的速度旋转时才会保持高效率，因此当需要驱动低速应用时，通常会接上减速齿轮，例如船舶的螺旋桨。在绝大多数大型发电站中，涡轮机直接连接到发电机且没有减速齿轮装置。美国涡轮机通常速度为 3600转/分钟 （RPM），电力是60赫兹。欧洲和其他国家是3000转/分钟，电力系统是50赫兹。在核动力应用中，涡轮机通常以这些速度的一半运行，即1800转/分钟和1500转/分钟。涡轮转子也仅能够在朝一个方向旋转时提供动力。因此，在需要反方向供电的情况下，通常需要换向级或变速箱。[需要引证]

蒸汽涡轮由安装在 驱动轴 上的一个或多个转子（ 旋转盘 ）组成，与固定在 涡轮机壳体 上的一系列定子（ 静止盘 ）交替。转子的外侧边缘具有类似螺旋桨的叶片布置。蒸汽作用在这些扇叶上，产生旋转动作。定子由一系列类似的固定扇叶组成，将蒸汽流重新定向到下一个转子层级上。蒸汽涡轮机经常把废气排放到提供真空的表面冷凝器中。为了从特定速度和压力的蒸汽中提取最大潜势，蒸汽涡轮通常会设置可变尺寸的高压和低压多个层级。涡轮机只有在以相对较高的速度旋转时才会保持高效率，因此当需要驱动低速应用时，通常会接上减速齿轮，例如船舶的螺旋桨。在绝大多数大型发电站中，涡轮机直接连接到发电机且没有减速齿轮装置。美国涡轮机通常速度为 3600转/分钟 （RPM），电力是60赫兹。欧洲和其他国家是3000转/分钟，电力系统是50赫兹。在核动力应用中，涡轮机通常以这些速度的一半运行，即1800转/分钟和1500转/分钟。涡轮转子也仅能够在朝一个方向旋转时提供动力。因此，在需要反方向供电的情况下，通常需要换向级或变速箱。[需要引证]

Passage:

1773 年或更早的时候卡尔·威尔海姆·舍勒在乌普萨拉独立发现氧气，而约瑟夫·普利斯特里在 1774 年在威尔特郡也独立发现了氧气，但后者常常被优先认定，因为 他的发现首先发表 。氧气的名称是由 安托万·拉瓦锡 于1777年命名的，他的氧气实验帮助推翻了当时流行的 燃烧和腐蚀燃素理论 。氧气的名字来源于希腊词根ὀξύς oxys（“酸”），字面意思是“尖锐”，指酸味。另一部分来源于-γενής -genes（“生产者”），字面意思是“生产者”，因为在命名时，人们错以为所有酸的组成中都含有氧。 氧气的常见用途包括钢铁、塑料和纺织品的生产过程，还有钢等其他金属的硬焊、熔焊、切割，火箭推进剂，氧气疗法以及飞机、潜艇、航天和潜水中的生命支持系统。

Question:

卡尔·威尔海姆·舍勒于何时发现氧气?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
1773 or earlier" for the discovery of oxygen by Carl Wilhelm Scheele.

The discovery of oxygen by Scheele was not widely known at the time, and it was not until 1774 that Joseph Priestley discovered oxygen independently in England and published his findings. Priestley's name was given to the element, and his experiments helped to overturn the popular theory of combustion and corrosive oxidation at the time.

The name oxygen comes from the Greek word oxys, which means "acid" or "sharp," referring to its sour taste. Another part of the name comes from genes, which means "producer," referring to its role in producing acids in chemical reactions. The name was chosen because people at the time mistakenly believed that all acids contained oxygen.

Oxygen is commonly used in steel, plastic, and other metal manufacturing processes, as well as in hardening, welding, cutting, rocket propulsion, oxygen therapy, and aircraft, submarines, and spacecraft life support systems.

1891年 ，苏格兰化学家 詹姆斯·杜瓦 成功制造出足够数量的液氧进行研究。 第一个商业化制造液氧的方法是由德国工程师Carl von Linde和英国工程师William Hampson于 1895年 独立开发的。 两人都通过降低了空气的温度直至氧气液化，然后依次蒸馏各气体成分。 后来，在1901年，人们通过燃烧乙炔和压缩氧气的混合物首次实现 氧乙炔焊接 。 这种焊接和切割金属的方法后来变得很普遍。

system:
Carl von Linde and William Hampson".

Carl von Linde (1842-1934) was a German engineer and inventor who developed the first commercial method of liquefying oxygen. He was born in Berlin, Germany, and studied engineering at the University of Berlin. In 1873, he began working as an engineer for the Siemens Company. In 1879, he patented a method for liquefying oxygen using a vacuum pump. This method was later improved by William Hampson (1850-1921), an English engineer who worked for the British Oxygen Company. Together, they developed a process for producing liquid oxygen that was used in research and industry.

The process involved cooling air to a temperature below its freezing point, then separating the oxygen from other gases by distillation. The oxygen was then compressed and stored in tanks until it was needed for research or industrial applications. The process was later improved by other engineers, including Charles William Siemens (1864-1943), who developed a more efficient method of producing liquid oxygen.

In 1891, Linde and Hampson successfully produced enough liquid oxygen to conduct research on its properties and uses. Their method was later used to produce large quantities of liquid oxygen for commercial and industrial applications. The process of liquefying oxygen has continued to be used in research and industry, and is still important today in the production of medical oxygen and in the storage of hydrogen fuel cells.

1891年 ，苏格兰化学家 詹姆斯·杜瓦 成功制造出足够数量的液氧进行研究。 第一个商业化制造液氧的方法是由德国工程师Carl von Linde和英国工程师William Hampson于 1895年 独立开发的。 两人都通过降低了空气的温度直至氧气液化，然后依次蒸馏各气体成分。 后来，在1901年，人们通过燃烧乙炔和压缩氧气的混合物首次实现 氧乙炔焊接 。 这种焊接和切割金属的方法后来变得很普遍。

1901年实现了氧乙炔焊接工艺"。

The passage describes the development of the process of oxygen welding, which is a welding process that uses oxygen and an oxidizer to join metals. The process was developed in 1891 by Scottish chemist James Dewar and German engineer Carl von Linde, and it was independently developed by William Hampson in 1895. Both engineers used a process of lowering the temperature of air until it reached oxygen gas, then separating the gases into their components. Later, in 1901, the process of oxygen welding was achieved by burning acetylene and compressing oxygen gas. This process and cutting metal with oxygen and acetylene became very common.

古气候学家 通过测量海洋生物的壳和骨骼中氧-18和氧-16的比例来确定数百万年前的 气候 （参见氧同位素比率循环）。含有较轻的氧同位素氧-16的海水分子比含有氧-18（比氧-16重 12% ）的水分子的蒸发速度略快; 这种差异在 较低温度 的时期会加剧。 在全球气温较低的时期，降雪和降雨以及水蒸气的氧-16含量往往更高，留下的海水往往含有更多的 氧-18 ，于是海洋生物将更多氧-18纳入其骨骼和贝壳中，温暖气候时情况则相反。古气候学家还直接测量了数十万年前的冰芯样品中水分子的这一比例。

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
remote sensing". Remote sensing is a method of collecting data about the Earth's surface without physically being present at the location. It involves using satellites to collect data from a distance and analyzing it to understand the Earth's surface. Remote sensing is used by scientists to measure global radiation, which is the total amount of energy from the sun that reaches the Earth's surface.

Remote sensing can be used to measure global radiation in a variety of ways, including using satellites to measure the amount of radiation reflected by the Earth's surface and vegetation, and using ground-based sensors to measure the amount of radiation that reaches the Earth's surface. These measurements can provide valuable information about the Earth's climate and environment, as well as help scientists understand how different factors, such as vegetation and clouds, affect global radiation levels.

In conclusion, remote sensing is a powerful tool that scientists use to measure global radiation and understand its impact on the Earth's climate and environment.

高压氧药物使用特殊 氧气室 来增加患者周围的氧气分压，并在需要时增加医务人员。这些设备有时被用来治疗一氧化碳中毒、气性坏疽和减压症。肺中氧浓度的增加有助于替换血红蛋白血红素中的 一氧化碳 。 氧气对引起气性坏疽的 厌氧菌 有毒，因此增加氧气分压有助于杀死厌氧菌。 在潜水后减压过快的潜水员会发生 减压症 ，导致血液中形成惰性气体气泡，主要是氮气和氦气。尽快增加氧气压力是治疗的一部分。

system: high-pressure oxygen equipment is used to increase the oxygen pressure around the patient's surroundings and to increase the number of medical personnel when needed. These devices are sometimes used to treat carbon monoxide poisoning, gas gangrene, and decompression sickness. Increasing the oxygen concentration in the lungs can help replace hemoglobin with oxygen-carrying blood cells, such as oxyhemoglobin. Increasing the oxygen pressure can also help kill bacteria that cause gas gangrene, such as Clostridium perfringens. After diving too quickly, a diver may develop decompression sickness due to the formation of inert gas bubbles, mainly nitrogen and helium. Increasing the oxygen pressure is part of the treatment for decompression sickness."

The oil embargo refers to the ban on the export of crude oil from the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) in 1973, which led to a sharp increase in oil prices and a significant disruption in the global economy. The embargo was imposed in response to the Arab-Israeli conflict and was intended to pressure the United States to withdraw its support for Israel. The embargo had a significant impact on the U.S. economy, as it disrupted the supply of oil and led to higher prices for gasoline, diesel, and other petroleum-based products. Additionally, the embargo created uncertainty about the future of energy supplies, which had a negative impact on investment and economic growth.

The oil embargo was a major event that had a significant impact on the global economy and on the United States in particular. It highlighted the importance of energy security and the need for diversification of energy sources. It also highlighted the importance of international cooperation and coordination in addressing global challenges, such as energy security.

﻿推动欧盟形成的主要条约 从 《煤钢共同体条约》开始，然后是《原子能共同体条约》，但是通过1957年的 《罗马条约》和 1992 年的《马斯特里赫特条约》（现为：TFEU），建立了更加完善和正式的机构。在1960年代和1970年代进行了一些小的修改。在 1986 年的《欧洲单一法案》中，为了完成单一内部市场的建立，签署了重要的修正条约，在1997年的《阿姆斯特丹条约》中进一步发展一个更加社会化的欧洲，并在2001年的《尼斯条约》和2007年的《里斯本条约》中对欧盟各机构成员国的相对权力做了一些小的修改。自成立以来，更多的成员国通过一系列加入条约加入了欧盟，从 1972 年的英国、爱尔兰、丹麦和挪威（虽然挪威最终 没有 加入），1979年的希腊， 1985 年的西班牙和葡萄牙，1994年的奥地利、芬兰、挪威和瑞典（虽然挪威再次没能加入，因为在公投中没有获得足够支持），2004年的捷克共和国、塞浦路斯、爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、拉脱维亚、立陶宛、马耳他、波兰、斯洛伐克和斯洛文尼亚，2007年的罗马尼亚和保加利亚和2013年的克罗地亚。 格陵兰岛 在 1985 年签署了一项条约，给予它特殊地位。

The ECSC Treaty was signed in 1951 by France, West Germany, Italy, Belgium, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands. It established a common market for coal and steel production in Europe. The treaty also created the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC), which was responsible for managing the common market.

The ECSC Treaty paved the way for further integration in Europe, leading to the signing of the Treaty of Rome in 1957, which established the European Economic Community (EEC). The EEC was a precursor to the EU, which was formed in 1993 through a series of treaties.

The ECSC Treaty was an important step in the creation of the EU, as it laid the foundation for further integration and cooperation among European countries. The treaty paved the way for future treaties that led to the formation of the EU, which has since grown to include more than 27 member states.

system:
The Single European Act (1986) and the Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) provided the European Union with more formal institutions."

The Single European Act (1986) was a treaty between the European Community and its member states that aimed to increase economic integration within the European Union. It established a single market for goods, services, and capital, and created a common external tariff. The Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) was a revision of the Single European Act that further developed the European Union by creating a more socialized Europe, and it also made some small changes to the relative powers of the European institutions.

These two treaties provided the European Union with more formal institutions by establishing a more unified structure and increasing its powers. The Single European Act created the European Commission, which became the executive branch of the European Union, and it also established the Court of Justice, which is responsible for enforcing EU law. The Treaty of Amsterdam expanded the powers of the European Parliament and created a new post of President of the European Council. These two treaties also established a permanent President of the European Council, which is responsible for coordinating EU policy among member states.

Overall, these two treaties provided the European Union with more formal institutions by establishing a more unified structure and increasing its powers. They also helped to create a more socialized Europe by increasing economic integration and creating a single market for goods, services, and capital. These treaties were important steps in the development of the European Union and helped to shape its future as a political entity.

The need for the final form of the European Union's treaties arose from the desire to create a more integrated and formal organization."

The European Union (EU) is a political and economic union of 27 member states that was established in 1993. The EU was created through a series of treaties, which were signed by the member states and ratified by their parliaments. The treaties established the European Community, which was later renamed the European Union.

The creation of the EU was motivated by a desire to promote economic integration, peace, and cooperation among its member states. The creation of a single market and a common currency were seen as key steps in achieving these goals. However, the process of creating the EU was not without its challenges.

One of the most significant challenges was overcoming political and economic differences among the member states. The creation of a single market required harmonization of regulations and standards across borders, which was not always easy to achieve. Additionally, some member states had concerns about losing their sovereignty or control over their economies.

Another challenge was ensuring that the EU remained democratic and accountable to its citizens. The creation of a common currency required significant changes to national budgets and fiscal policies, which could be difficult for some countries to accept.

Despite these challenges, the creation of the EU was ultimately successful in creating a more integrated and formal organization that has promoted peace, cooperation, and economic growth in Europe.

1992". The 1992 Maastricht Treaty, also known as the Treaty on European Union (TEU), is a treaty that established the European Union (EU) as a political and economic union. It was signed on 7 February 1992 by representatives of the member states of the European Community, and entered into force on 1 November 1993. The Maastricht Treaty was the first of three treaties that created the EU, and it established the European Commission, the European Parliament, and the European Court of Justice as permanent institutions of the EU. It also created a single market for goods, services, and capital within the EU, and established a common currency, the euro. The Maastricht Treaty was followed by the Amsterdam Treaty in 1997, which further expanded the powers of the EU institutions and created a new post of President of the European Council. The Lisbon Treaty, which came into force in 2009, made further changes to the structure and powers of the EU institutions.

The Maastricht Treaty was signed by representatives of all member states of the European Community at a summit in Maastricht, Netherlands. The treaty was ratified by all member states except Denmark, which held a referendum on its ratification in June 1993. Denmark subsequently ratified the treaty in December 1993. The Maastricht Treaty established a new legal basis for EU decision-making, replacing the previous intergovernmental system with a supranational system based on qualified majority voting in most policy areas. It also created a new permanent body, the European Council, to replace the previous intergovernmental system of summits of heads of state or government. The treaty also established a new post of President of the European Council to lead EU summits and oversee implementation of EU policies.

The Maastricht Treaty was controversial at the time of its signing and ratification. Some critics argued that it gave too much power to unelected officials and reduced national sovereignty. Others argued that it did not go far enough in creating a fully integrated political union and that it did not address important issues such as immigration and economic integration. However, over time, many critics have come to view the Maastricht Treaty as an important step towards creating a more unified Europe. It has been credited with helping to stabilize Europe after the Cold War and with promoting economic integration and peace in Europe. The Maastricht Treaty has also been seen as laying the foundations for further integration in Europe, with subsequent treaties such as the Lisbon Treaty establishing further powers for EU institutions and creating a single EU budget.

In summary, the Maastricht Treaty was signed on 7 February 1992 by representatives of all member states of the European Community at a summit in Maastricht, Netherlands. It established a new legal basis for EU decision-making, created a new permanent body, the European Council, to replace the previous intergovernmental system of summits of heads of state or government, and established a new post of President of the European Council to lead EU summits and oversee implementation of EU policies. The treaty was controversial at the time of its signing and ratification but has been seen as laying important foundations for further integration in Europe over time.

The Single European Act was a treaty that established the European Community as a single market and paved the way for the creation of the European Union. It was signed by representatives of the member states of the European Community on March 17, 1986, and came into force on November 1, 1987. The Single European Act was a significant step in the integration of Europe, as it established a common market and created a more socialized Europe. It also paved the way for further integration, as it led to the signing of the Amsterdam Treaty in 1997 and the Nice Treaty in 2001, which made further changes to the powers of the European institutions and increased the relative power of some member states. Since its adoption, more member states have joined the European Union through a series of accession treaties, including Britain, Ireland, Denmark, and Norway (although Denmark ultimately did not join), Greece in 1981, Spain and Portugal in 1985, Austria, Finland, Sweden, and Iceland in 1994, Croatia in 2013 (although it did not join due to lack of support in a public referendum), and most recently, Bulgaria, Romania, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Hungary, Slovakia, Slovenia, Malta, Cyprus, and Poland in 2004.

The act established a self-governing territorial administration for Greenland, with a democratically elected government and a legislature. It also provided for the transfer of certain U.S. military bases in Greenland to the Danish government. The act was controversial at the time, with some critics arguing that it was an example of colonialism and that it would undermine the sovereignty of Greenland. However, supporters argued that it would provide Greenland with greater autonomy and economic opportunities, while still maintaining its close ties to the United States.

Passage:

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Question:

哪两个管理机构拥有立法否决权？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: European Parliament and European Council". The European Parliament and the European Council have legislative power, but the European Parliament has veto power in the legislative process. According to Article 9 of the Treaty on the European Union, the European Union adheres to the principle of "equal citizenship", which aims to establish a democratic system based on "representative democracy". In practice, equality and democracy are flawed because representatives elected by the people cannot initiate legislation that goes against the will of the European Council, and the voting power of the smallest member state is ten times that of the largest member state. To pass legislation, a qualified majority or consensus is required in the European Council. According to Article 11 of the Treaty on European Union, citizens have limited rights: compared with all EU member states' democratic systems, citizens' rights are subject to restrictions: according to Article 11 of the Treaty on European Union, citizens and associations have the right to express their views publicly, and a committee of 100,000 signatories must be consulted by a committee of representatives. Article 227 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union provides for citizens' right to request a referendum on issues that affect them. Every five years, a European Parliament election and member state elections are held to elect members of the European Parliament and single transferable vote is used to organize them. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are appointed according to a proportional system based on each member state's population. This means that—despite being a representative body—smaller member states have more representatives than larger member states in the European Parliament. The allocation of seats in the European Parliament is based on a proportional system that allocates seats according to each member state's population. The allocation of seats in the European Council is based on party politics: The European People's Party is currently the largest party in the European Parliament, while The European Socialists are considered as opposition leaders. Political parties do not accept public funding from the EU as they should be accountable to their respective national governments, as was decided by the Court of Justice in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v Conseil de l'Union européenne. The powers of the European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special envoy before any court proceedings are initiated. It can also request information from committees and issue non-binding resolutions against entire committees. In certain cases, it has clear negotiating powers: for example, it can require committees to comply with resolutions or demand that they provide detailed explanations for non-compliance. However, it still has limited powers in terms of legislation because it cannot pass legislation without both committees and the Council. This means that power (demos) does not lie with directly elected representatives but with "the people" as a whole: In Europe, democracy is not truly in the hands of a majority but rather in those who hold power.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Question:

议会不能做什么导致了平等和民主是有缺陷的？

system:
The European Parliament and the European Council have monopoly power over legislation, but the European Parliament and the European Council have veto power over legislation during the legislative process. According to Article 9 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU), the EU is committed to "respect for fundamental rights, including the principles of democracy, the rule of law and respect for human dignity." In practice, democracy is flawed because representatives are elected on a proportional basis, but legislation that goes against the wishes of the smallest member states is subject to a veto by the largest member states. The European Parliament has a smaller voting power than the European Council, which requires a qualified majority or consensus among all member states. According to Article 11 of the TFEU, citizens have limited rights in comparison to all EU member states' democracies: citizens and associations have a right to express their views publicly, and they must submit a proposal for a resolution with 100,000 signatures to be considered by a committee of MEPs. Article 227 of the TFEU provides for citizens' right to request that their interests be taken into account by the EU institutions. Every five years, citizens elect members of the European Parliament and members of national parliaments in each EU member state. The European Parliament is organized proportionally according to single transferable vote or single non-transferable vote, depending on whether it is elected by national parliaments or directly by citizens. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are allocated according to a "proportionality" ratio based on each member state's population. This means that—despite being an institution that represents EU member states—smaller member states' citizens have more speaking power than larger member states' citizens in the EU institutions. The allocation of MEPs and representation in national parliaments are based on proportional representation according to party political lines: The European People's Party is currently the largest party in the European Parliament, while the European Socialists are considered to be opposition leaders. Political parties do not accept public funding from the EU, as was ruled by the European Court of Justice in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v Conseil de l'UE, which found that this issue is one that should be left up to individual member states to regulate. The powers of the European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special envoy before any court proceedings are initiated. It can also request information from committees and issue non-binding resolutions on issues at hand. In certain cases, it has clear negotiating powers over legislation, such as when it must comply with resolutions passed by committees or when it must actually implement decisions made by the Council and Commission. However, its role in legislative processes remains limited because it cannot pass legislation without both committees and the Council and Commission. This means that power does not lie with directly elected representatives (demos) but with a minority of people who hold most of the power in Europe.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

system: The European Parliament and the European Council". The European Parliament and the European Council are the two main institutions that are responsible for passing legislation in the European Union. The European Parliament is a directly elected body, while the European Council is made up of representatives from each member state. The European Parliament has the power to initiate legislation, while the European Council has the power to approve or reject legislation proposed by the European Parliament. In practice, however, these institutions are not always able to pass legislation without compromise or without taking into account the interests of smaller member states. The passage also mentions that these institutions have been granted more powers over time, with the introduction of direct elections for members of the European Parliament in 1979 and the establishment of a more direct role for the European Parliament in legislative processes in 2019. These developments have led to a gradual increase in the powers of the European Parliament, with more words being given to it in legislative processes and more influence being given to it in decision-making. However, these institutions are still limited in their powers, as they do not have complete control over legislative processes without the involvement of other institutions such as the European Council and the European Commission. In summary, the answer to your question is "The European Parliament and the European Council".

European Commission". The European Commission is the executive body of the European Union, which has the power to propose legislation and implement decisions made by the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union. The European Commission is responsible for implementing EU policies and enforcing EU law, and it has a monopoly on initiating legislative proposals. The European Commission is composed of a President and 27 Commissioners, who are appointed by the European Council and approved by the European Parliament. The President of the European Commission is the head of the executive branch of the EU, while the Commissioners are responsible for implementing EU policies in their respective areas of responsibility. The European Commission has a significant role in shaping EU policy, as it is responsible for proposing legislation, negotiating international agreements, and enforcing EU law. The European Commission also has a significant amount of power over other EU institutions, as it has the power to propose legislation that must be approved by the European Parliament and Council. In addition, the European Commission has a significant amount of power over national governments, as it can initiate infringement procedures against Member States that do not comply with EU law. Overall, the European Commission is a powerful institution that has significant influence over EU policy-making and enforcement.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Question:

哪些实体在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
European Parliament and European Council". European Parliament and European Council have the power to amend and reject the legislation during the legislative process. According to Article 9 and Article 10 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, European Union is committed to "equality principle" and aims to establish a democratic system based on "representative democracy". In practice, equality and democracy are flawed because representatives are elected by a small group of people and legislation proposed by the European Commission cannot be rejected by the European Parliament if it is against the interests of small states. The voting power of European Parliament is ten times smaller than that of the largest member state, while the voting power of European Council is proportional to the size of each member state. According to the Treaty, this "democratic deficit" is justified by the fact that, in order to achieve complete integration, European Economic and Political Union requires specialized technical coordination, while public understanding of Europe has increased since World War II. As time goes on, this means that European Parliament gradually gains more words in legislation: from never elected, to directly elected in 1979, and then in more rights in legislation process. Therefore, compared with all European member states' democracies, citizens' rights are limited: according to Article 11 of TEU, citizens and associations have the right to express their opinions publicly, and a committee of 100,000 signatures must be submitted for a proposal for a resolution by European Parliament. Article 227 of TEU further provides that citizens can request a direct petition to European Parliament if their interests are affected by proposed legislation. Every five years, European Parliament elections and member states' national elections elect representatives who represent EU citizens proportionally or single-member vote. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are appointed according to proportional representation based on each member state's population. This means that—despite being a representative body—European Parliament is more representative for smaller member states than for larger ones. This is because proportional representation means that more citizens from smaller member states have more say in legislation than citizens from larger member states. The distribution of MEPs among member states is based on party politics: The largest party in each country becomes the largest group in European Parliament. The Socialists and Democrats are currently leading in terms of MEPs. Political parties do not accept public funding from EU institutions, just like the European Court ruled in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v Conseil de l'Union européenne that this is an issue that should be handled by individual member states. The powers of European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special envoy before any court proceedings begin. It can also request information from committees on specific issues and can criticize entire committees with a two-thirds majority vote like Santer Commission did in 1999. In certain cases, it has clear negotiating powers but must still comply with these powers. However, its role in legislative processes remains limited as it cannot pass laws without committees and Council. This means that power (demos) does not lie with directly elected representatives but with people who are not directly elected but still have power over legislation through majority voting in EU institutions like Council or European Commission.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Passage:

自欧盟成立以来，它在越来越多的国家和全球化的法律体系中运作。这意味着 欧洲法院和最高国家法院 都必须制定原则来解决不同制度之间的法律冲突。在欧盟内部，法院的观点是，如果 欧盟法律 与国内法的规定相冲突，那么欧盟法律具有优先权。在 1964年 的第一起重大案列中，一位米兰律师和能源公司的前股东，科斯塔拒绝向Enel支付电费，作为对这家意大利能源公司的国有化的抗议。他声称，意大利国有化法与《罗马条约》相冲突，并要求在TFEU第267条之下同时参照意大利宪法法院和欧洲法院。意大利宪法法院给出的意见是， 由于国有化法是1962年制定的，而条约是1958年生效的，所以科斯塔无权提起诉讼。相比之下， 欧洲法院 认为《罗马条约》根本没有阻止能源国有化，而且在任何情况下，根据条约条款，只有欧盟委员会才有权提起诉讼，而科斯塔无权。但是，原则上，科斯塔先生有权声称该条约与国内法相冲突，如果没有人对其决定提出上诉，法院将有责任考虑他提出的进行参照的要求。欧洲法院在 Van Gend en Loos 重申了它的观点，称会员国“在互惠的基础上”，“尽管在有限的范围内，限制了它们的主权权利并建立了一套既适用于它们的国民也适用于它们自己的法律体系”。欧盟法律不会“被国内法律条款所覆盖，无论其框架如何……在没有对共同体本身的法律提出质疑的情况下。”这意味着会员国的任何“后来的单方面行动”都是不适用的。同样的，在 Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA 案列中，一家公司，Simmenthatl SpA，声称根据1970年意大利的一项法律，从法国进口牛肉的公共健康检查费违反了 1964年和1968年 的两项规定。法院表示，根据“共同体法律优先原则”，“直接适用的制度措施”（如案列中的规定）“自动使现行国内法的任何冲突规定不适用”。为了防止可能“危及欧盟根本基础”的对于“成员国无条件和不可撤销地承担的条约义务”的“相应拒绝”，这是必要的。但是，尽管欧洲法院的这种意见，各会员国的国家法院却没有接受同样的分析。

如果欧盟法律和国家法律之间存在冲突，哪一项法律优先？

Question:

意大利宪法法院给出的什么理由导致科斯塔先生在对ENEL的诉讼中败诉？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The Italian Constitutional Court gave the following reasons for the plaintiff's defeat in his lawsuit against ENEL:

1. The 1964 Treaty of Rome, which established the European Economic Community, was a treaty between sovereign states, and therefore the EU treaties were not subject to domestic law.

2. The 1968 Treaty of Rome, which established the European Atomic Energy Community, was a treaty between sovereign states, and therefore the EU treaties were not subject to domestic law.

3. The 1970 Italian law that imposed a public health inspection fee on imported beef from France was a domestic law, and therefore it was not subject to EU law.

4. The EU treaties were not subject to domestic law because they were directly applicable rules, and therefore any conflict between domestic law and EU law was automatically resolved in favor of EU law."

自欧盟成立以来，它在越来越多的国家和全球化的法律体系中运作。这意味着 欧洲法院和最高国家法院 都必须制定原则来解决不同制度之间的法律冲突。在欧盟内部，法院的观点是，如果 欧盟法律 与国内法的规定相冲突，那么欧盟法律具有优先权。在 1964年 的第一起重大案列中，一位米兰律师和能源公司的前股东，科斯塔拒绝向Enel支付电费，作为对这家意大利能源公司的国有化的抗议。他声称，意大利国有化法与《罗马条约》相冲突，并要求在TFEU第267条之下同时参照意大利宪法法院和欧洲法院。意大利宪法法院给出的意见是， 由于国有化法是1962年制定的，而条约是1958年生效的，所以科斯塔无权提起诉讼。相比之下， 欧洲法院 认为《罗马条约》根本没有阻止能源国有化，而且在任何情况下，根据条约条款，只有欧盟委员会才有权提起诉讼，而科斯塔无权。但是，原则上，科斯塔先生有权声称该条约与国内法相冲突，如果没有人对其决定提出上诉，法院将有责任考虑他提出的进行参照的要求。欧洲法院在 Van Gend en Loos 重申了它的观点，称会员国“在互惠的基础上”，“尽管在有限的范围内，限制了它们的主权权利并建立了一套既适用于它们的国民也适用于它们自己的法律体系”。欧盟法律不会“被国内法律条款所覆盖，无论其框架如何……在没有对共同体本身的法律提出质疑的情况下。”这意味着会员国的任何“后来的单方面行动”都是不适用的。同样的，在 Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA 案列中，一家公司，Simmenthatl SpA，声称根据1970年意大利的一项法律，从法国进口牛肉的公共健康检查费违反了 1964年和1968年 的两项规定。法院表示，根据“共同体法律优先原则”，“直接适用的制度措施”（如案列中的规定）“自动使现行国内法的任何冲突规定不适用”。为了防止可能“危及欧盟根本基础”的对于“成员国无条件和不可撤销地承担的条约义务”的“相应拒绝”，这是必要的。但是，尽管欧洲法院的这种意见，各会员国的国家法院却没有接受同样的分析。
